text: Esther Okade is a British-Nigerian mathematics child prodigy from Walsall, United Kingdom. She was described by CNN as a "maths genius", and is one of the UK's youngest freshmen. In 2015, at the age of 10, she enrolled at the Open University, a UK-based distance learning college. Her mother started homeschooling her at the age of three, and at the age of six she took her first GCSE exams at the Ounsdale High School in Wolverhampton. She is the author of a series of mathematics workbooks for children called "Yummy Yummy Algebra". As of 2019, she was working on a PhD. ==References== Category:English people of Nigerian descent Category:People from Walsall Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Esther Okade
